ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a course on 'repetion' not in the sense of a critical history of a concept or a history of a literary period or genre. Instead, it brings diverse but related texts together and solicits reflections on what is at stake in literature and philosophy with repetition. I would recommend the seminar.
A meaningfully repetitive reflection on repetition, as it occurs in the 19thC literary& philosophical tradition,& elsewhere. I would recommend it.
Absolutely - very different teaching style to any other class I've taken at Yale, but one I loved. Very manageable reading load, also.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course introduced a constellation of texts important to the literary canon of my field and important to subfields like the history of psychoanalysis and literary theory.
